description: Uploaded by https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/runbooks/-/jobs/3029253226 at Wed Sep 14 18:34:40 UTC 2022

panels.description: Error rates are a measure of unhandled service exceptions per second. Client errors are excluded when possible. Lower is better

seriesOverrides.alias: 6h Degradation SLO (5% of monthly error budget)
1h Outage SLO (2% of monthly error budget)

targets.legendFormat: 6h Degradation SLO (5% of monthly error budget)
1h Outage SLO (2% of monthly error budget)

panels.title: pgbouncer-registry Service Error Ratio

targets.expr:
sum (
  label_replace(
    vector(0) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_1h{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",type="pgbouncer-registry"}),
    "period", "na", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(1) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_5m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",type="pgbouncer-registry"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (14.4 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="",monitor="global",type="pgbouncer-registry"})),
    "period", "5m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(2) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_1h{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",type="pgbouncer-registry"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (14.4 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="",monitor="global",type="pgbouncer-registry"})),
    "period", "1h", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(4) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_30m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",type="pgbouncer-registry"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (6 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="",monitor="global",type="pgbouncer-registry"})),
    "period", "30m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(8) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_6h{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",type="pgbouncer-registry"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (6 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="",monitor="global",type="pgbouncer-registry"})),
    "period", "6h", "", ""
  )
)

panels.description: The operation rate is the sum total of all requests being handle for all components within this service. Note that a single user request can lead to requests to multiple components. Higher is busier.

panels.title: service SLI Error Ratio

targets.expr:
sum (
  label_replace(
    vector(0) and on() (gitlab_component_errors:ratio_1h{component="service",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",type="pgbouncer-registry"}),
    "period", "na", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(1) and on() (gitlab_component_errors:ratio_5m{component="service",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",type="pgbouncer-registry"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (14.4 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="service",monitor="global",type="pgbouncer-registry"})),
    "period", "5m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(2) and on() (gitlab_component_errors:ratio_1h{component="service",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",type="pgbouncer-registry"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (14.4 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="service",monitor="global",type="pgbouncer-registry"})),
    "period", "1h", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(4) and on() (gitlab_component_errors:ratio_30m{component="service",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",type="pgbouncer-registry"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (6 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="service",monitor="global",type="pgbouncer-registry"})),
    "period", "30m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(8) and on() (gitlab_component_errors:ratio_6h{component="service",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",type="pgbouncer-registry"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (6 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="service",monitor="global",type="pgbouncer-registry"})),
    "period", "6h", "", ""
  )
)

panels.description: The operation rate is the sum total of all requests being handle for all components within this service. Note that a single user request can lead to requests to multiple components. Higher is busier.
panels.title: service SLI RPS - Requests per Second

panels.content:
### Description

All transactions destined for the Postgres primary instance are routed through the pgbouncer service.
This SLI models those transactions in aggregate.

Error rate uses mtail metrics from pgbouncer logs.



### Observability Tools

* [ðŸ“– Kibana: pgbouncer logs](https://log.gprd.gitlab.net/app/kibana#/discover?_a=(columns:!(json.hostname,json.pg_message),filters:!((meta:(key:json.type.keyword,params:'pgbouncer-registry',type:phrase),query:(match:(json.type.keyword:(query:'pgbouncer-registry',type:phrase)))),(meta:(key:json.tag.keyword,params:postgres.pgbouncer,type:phrase),query:(match:(json.tag.keyword:(query:postgres.pgbouncer,type:phrase)))),(meta:(key:json.type,params:'pgbouncer-registry',type:phrase),query:(match:(json.type:(query:'pgbouncer-registry',type:phrase))))),index:'97f04200-024b-11eb-81e5-155ba78758d4')&_g=(time:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}')))
* [ðŸ“ˆ Kibana: pgbouncer requests](https://log.gprd.gitlab.net/app/kibana#/visualize/create?type=line&indexPattern=97f04200-024b-11eb-81e5-155ba78758d4&_a=(filters:!((meta:(key:json.type.keyword,params:'pgbouncer-registry',type:phrase),query:(match:(json.type.keyword:(query:'pgbouncer-registry',type:phrase)))),(meta:(key:json.tag.keyword,params:postgres.pgbouncer,type:phrase),query:(match:(json.tag.keyword:(query:postgres.pgbouncer,type:phrase)))),(meta:(key:json.type,params:'pgbouncer-registry',type:phrase),query:(match:(json.type:(query:'pgbouncer-registry',type:phrase))))),query:(language:kuery,query:''),vis:(aggs:!((enabled:!t,id:'1',params:(),schema:metric,type:count),(enabled:!t,id:'2',params:(drop_partials:!t,extended_bounds:(),field:json.time,interval:auto,min_doc_count:1,scaleMetricValues:!f,timeRange:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}'),useNormalizedEsInterval:!t),schema:segment,type:date_histogram))))&_g=(time:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}')))
panels.title: Details

panels.description: The amount of non-idle time consumed by nodes for this service
panels.title: Node CPU

panels.description: The maximum utilization of a single core on each node. Lower is better

panels.description: Network utilization for nodes for this service
panels.title: Node Network Utilization

panels.description: Memory utilization. Lower is better.
panels.title: Memory Utilization

panels.description: Disk Read IO operations per second. Lower is better.
panels.title: Disk Read IOPs

panels.description: Disk Write IO operations per second. Lower is better.

panels.description: Disk Read throughput datarate. Lower is better.
panels.title: Disk Read Throughput

panels.description: Disk Write throughput datarate. Lower is better.

panels.description: Total time spent in read operations across all disks on the node. Lower is better.

panels.description: Total time spent in write operations across all disks on the node. Lower is better.
panels.title: Disk Write Total Time

panels.description: CPU scheduling waiting on the run queue, as a percentage of time. Aggregated to worst CPU per node. Lower is better.
panels.title: CPU Scheduling Waiting

panels.description: Loadavg (1 minute) per core, below 1 is better.

targets.expr:
avg by (environment, type, stage, fqdn) (node_load1{env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="pgbouncer-registry"})
/
count by (environment, type, stage, fqdn) (node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle", env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="pgbouncer-registry"})

panels.title: loadavg1 per core

panels.description: Loadavg (5 minute) per core, below 1 is better.

targets.expr:
avg by (environment, type, stage, fqdn) (node_load5{env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="pgbouncer-registry"})
/
count by (environment, type, stage, fqdn) (node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle", env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="pgbouncer-registry"})

panels.title: loadavg5 per core

panels.description: Loadavg (15 minute) per core, below 1 is better.

targets.expr:
avg by (environment, type, stage, fqdn) (node_load15{env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="pgbouncer-registry"})
/
count by (environment, type, stage, fqdn) (node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle", env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="pgbouncer-registry"})

panels.title: loadavg15 per core

panels.description:
This resource measures average CPU utilization across an all cores in a service fleet.
If it is becoming saturated, it may indicate that the fleet needs
horizontal or vertical scaling.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      1 - avg by (environment, tier, type, stage) (
        rate(node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle", env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="pgbouncer-registry"}[5m])
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: cpu component saturation: Average Service CPU Utilization

panels.description:
Disk inode utilization per device per node.

If this is too high, its possible that a directory is filling up with
files. Consider logging in an checking temp directories for large numbers
of files
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn, device) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      1 - (
        node_filesystem_files_free{fstype=~"(ext.|xfs)", env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="pgbouncer-registry"}
        /
        node_filesystem_files{fstype=~"(ext.|xfs)", env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="pgbouncer-registry"}
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: disk_inodes component saturation: Disk inode Utilization per Device per Node

panels.description:
Disk space utilization per device per node.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn, device) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      (
        1 - node_filesystem_avail_bytes{fstype=~"ext.|xfs", env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="pgbouncer-registry"} / node_filesystem_size_bytes{fstype=~"ext.|xfs", env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="pgbouncer-registry"}
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: disk_space component saturation: Disk Space Utilization per Device per Node

panels.description:
Memory utilization per device per node.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      instance:node_memory_utilization:ratio{env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="pgbouncer-registry"} or instance:node_memory_utilisation:ratio{env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="pgbouncer-registry"}
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: memory component saturation: Memory Utilization per Node

panels.description:
Netfilter connection tracking table utilization per node.

When saturated, new connection attempts (incoming SYN packets) are dropped with no reply, leaving clients to slowly retry (and typically fail again) over the next several seconds.  When packets are being dropped due to this condition, kernel will log the event as: "nf_conntrack: table full, dropping packet".
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn, instance) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      max_over_time(node_nf_conntrack_entries{env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="pgbouncer-registry"}[1m])
      /
      node_nf_conntrack_entries_limit{env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="pgbouncer-registry"}
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: nf_conntrack_entries component saturation: conntrack Entries per Node

panels.description:
Measures the amount of scheduler waiting time that processes are waiting
to be scheduled, according to [`CPU Scheduling Metrics`](https://www.robustperception.io/cpu-scheduling-metrics-from-the-node-exporter).

A high value indicates that a node has more processes to be run than CPU time available
to handle them, and may lead to degraded responsiveness and performance from the application.

Additionally, it may indicate that the fleet is under-provisioned.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn, shard) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      avg without (cpu) (rate(node_schedstat_waiting_seconds_total{env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="pgbouncer-registry"}[1h]))
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: node_schedstat_waiting component saturation: Node Scheduler Waiting Time

panels.description:
Open file descriptor utilization per instance.

Saturation on file descriptor limits may indicate a resource-descriptor leak in the application.

As a temporary fix, you may want to consider restarting the affected process.
 Lower is better.
panels.title: open_fds component saturation: Open file descriptor utilization per instance

panels.description:
Client connections per pgbouncer process for Primary connections.

pgbouncer is configured to use a `max_client_conn` setting. This limits the total number of client connections per pgbouncer.

When this limit is reached, client connections may be refused, and `max_client_conn` errors may appear in the pgbouncer logs.

This could affect users as Rails clients are left unable to connect to the database. Another potential knock-on effect
is that Rails clients could fail their readiness checks for extended periods during a deployment, leading to saturation of
the older nodes.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      avg_over_time(pgbouncer_used_clients{env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="pgbouncer-registry"}[5m])
      /
      12000
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: pgbouncer_client_conn_primary component saturation: PGBouncer Client Connections per Process (Primary)

panels.description:
pgbouncer sync connection pool Saturation per database node, for primary database connections.

Web/api/git applications use a separate connection pool to sidekiq.

When this resource is saturated, web/api database operations may queue, leading to rails worker
saturation and 503 errors in the web.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn, instance) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      (
        avg_over_time(pgbouncer_pools_server_active_connections{user=~"gitlab|gitlab-registry", database=~"gitlabhq_registry|gitlabhq_production", env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="pgbouncer-registry"}[5m]) +
        avg_over_time(pgbouncer_pools_server_testing_connections{user=~"gitlab|gitlab-registry", database=~"gitlabhq_registry|gitlabhq_production", env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="pgbouncer-registry"}[5m]) +
        avg_over_time(pgbouncer_pools_server_used_connections{user=~"gitlab|gitlab-registry", database=~"gitlabhq_registry|gitlabhq_production", env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="pgbouncer-registry"}[5m]) +
        avg_over_time(pgbouncer_pools_server_login_connections{user=~"gitlab|gitlab-registry", database=~"gitlabhq_registry|gitlabhq_production", env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="pgbouncer-registry"}[5m])
      )
      / on(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn, instance) group_left()
      sum by (environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn, instance) (
        avg_over_time(pgbouncer_databases_pool_size{name=~"gitlabhq_registry|gitlabhq_production", env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="pgbouncer-registry"}[5m])
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: pgbouncer_sync_primary_pool component saturation: Postgres Sync (Web/API/Git) primary Connection Pool Utilization per Node

panels.description:
This resource measures average CPU utilization across an all cores in a shard of a
service fleet. If it is becoming saturated, it may indicate that the
shard needs horizontal or vertical scaling.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, shard) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      1 - avg by (environment, tier, type, stage, shard) (
        rate(node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle", env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="pgbouncer-registry"}[5m])
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: shard_cpu component saturation: Average CPU Utilization per Shard

panels.description:
Average CPU utilization per Node.

If average CPU is saturated, it may indicate that a fleet is in need to horizontal or vertical scaling. It may also indicate
imbalances in load in a fleet.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      avg without(cpu, mode) (1 - rate(node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle", env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="pgbouncer-registry"}[5m]))
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: single_node_cpu component saturation: Average CPU Utilization per Node

panels.description: Total number of SQL queries pooled - stats_total_query_count
panels.title: Queries Pooled per Node

panels.description: Total number of seconds spent by pgbouncer when actively connected to PostgreSQL, executing queries - stats.total_query_time
panels.title: Total Time in Queries per Node

panels.description: Total number of SQL transactions pooled - stats.total_xact_count
panels.title: SQL Transactions Pooled per Node

panels.description: Total number of seconds spent by pgbouncer when connected to PostgreSQL in a transaction, either idle in transaction or executing queries - stats.total_xact_time
panels.title: Time in Transaction per Server

panels.description: Number of active connections per node
panels.title: Server Connection Pool Active Connections per Node

panels.description: Shows connection saturation per pgbouncer pool. Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(clamp_max(sum by (database, env, environment, shard, stage, type) (
  pgbouncer_pools_server_active_connections{type="pgbouncer-registry", environment="$environment", user="gitlab-registry", database!="pgbouncer"} +
  pgbouncer_pools_server_testing_connections{type="pgbouncer-registry", environment="$environment", user="gitlab-registry", database!="pgbouncer"} +
  pgbouncer_pools_server_used_connections{type="pgbouncer-registry", environment="$environment", user="gitlab-registry", database!="pgbouncer"} +
  pgbouncer_pools_server_login_connections{type="pgbouncer-registry", environment="$environment", user="gitlab-registry", database!="pgbouncer"}
)
/
sum by (database, env, environment, shard, stage, type) (
  label_replace(
    pgbouncer_databases_pool_size{type="pgbouncer-registry", environment="$environment"},
    "database", "gitlabhq_production_sidekiq", "name", "gitlabhq_production_sidekiq"
  )
)
,1),0)

panels.title: Connection Saturation per Pool

panels.description: Shows connection saturation per pgbouncer pool, per pgbouncer node. Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(clamp_max(sum by (database, env, environment, fqdn, job, shard, stage, type) (
  pgbouncer_pools_server_active_connections{type="pgbouncer-registry", environment="$environment", user="gitlab-registry", database!="pgbouncer"} +
  pgbouncer_pools_server_testing_connections{type="pgbouncer-registry", environment="$environment", user="gitlab-registry", database!="pgbouncer"} +
  pgbouncer_pools_server_used_connections{type="pgbouncer-registry", environment="$environment", user="gitlab-registry", database!="pgbouncer"} +
  pgbouncer_pools_server_login_connections{type="pgbouncer-registry", environment="$environment", user="gitlab-registry", database!="pgbouncer"}
)
/
sum by (database, env, environment, fqdn, job, shard, stage, type) (
  label_replace(
    pgbouncer_databases_pool_size{type="pgbouncer-registry", environment="$environment"},
    "database", "gitlabhq_production_sidekiq", "name", "gitlabhq_production_sidekiq"
  )
)
,1),0)

panels.title: Connection Saturation per Pool per Node

panels.description: Total aggregated time spend waiting for a backend connection. Lower is better

targets.expr: sum by (database, environment, type) (rate(pgbouncer_stats_client_wait_seconds_total{type="pgbouncer-registry", environment="$environment", database!="pgbouncer"}[$__interval]) / on() group_left() (vector((time() < bool 1588233600) * 1000000) == 1000000 or vector(1)))

panels.title: Total Connection Wait Time

panels.description: Average time spent waiting for a backend connection from the pool. Lower is better

targets.expr:
sum by (database, environment, type, fqdn, job) (rate(pgbouncer_stats_client_wait_seconds_total{type="pgbouncer-registry", environment="$environment", database!="pgbouncer"}[$__interval]) / on() group_left() (vector((time() < bool 1588233600) * 1000000) == 1000000 or vector(1)))
/
sum by (database, environment, type, fqdn, job) (rate(pgbouncer_stats_sql_transactions_pooled_total{type="pgbouncer-registry", environment="$environment", database!="pgbouncer"}[$__interval]))

panels.title: Average Wait Time per SQL Transaction
Waiting Client Connections per Pool (âš ï¸ possibly inaccurate, occassionally polled value, do not make assumptions based on this)

panels.description:
pgbouncer is single-threaded. This graph shows maximum utilization across all cores on each host. Lower is better.

Missing data? [https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/gl-infra/reliability/-/issues/9980](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/gl-infra/reliability/-/issues/9980)

panels.description: Total volume in bytes of network traffic sent by pgbouncer, shown as bytes - stats.total_sent

panels.description: Total volume in bytes of network traffic received by pgbouncer, shown as bytes - stats.total_received
panels.title: Received Bytes

panels.title: Source

title: pgbouncer-registry: Overview
